faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

objectives.en: To provide basic knowledge in sustainable energetics processes, in energy preservation and conversion. Comprehend the problems and role of sustainable energetics in the development of society.
objectives.et:
Anda üliõpilasele ettevalmistus jätkusuutliku energeetika protsesside, energia säilitamise ja ülekande valdkonnas. 
Mõista säästva energeetika probleeme ja kohta jätkusuutliku ühiskonna arengus.

learning_outcomes.en: Graduates have acquired knowledge in sustainable energetics processes, issues related to energy conservation and conversion.
learning_outcomes.et: Lõpetajatel on teadmised jätkusuutliku energia säilitamise ja ülekande valdkonnas toimuvast, inseneri.

learning_outcomes.en: Graduates are able to collect scientific and technological information, interpret and use the data in problem-solving.
learning_outcomes.et: Suudab analüüsida, hinnata ja pakkuda innovatiivseid lahendusi eriala tehnilistele ja tehnoloogilistele probleemidele.

learning_outcomes.en: Graduates are able to understand connections between different processes and to apply theoretical knowledge in process planning.
learning_outcomes.et: Oskab koguda teaduslik-tehnoloogiaalast informatsiooni, seda loovalt tõlgendada ning kasutada probleemide lahendamisel ja enesetäiendamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: Graduates have acquired and are able to assess problems and the role of sustainable energetics in the development of society.
learning_outcomes.et: Tunneb ja oskab hinnata säästva energeetika probleeme ja kohta jätkusuutliku ühiskonna arengus.

grade_preconditions.et: 5 practical works have to be done. Practical work repots should be  accepted and the results  defended.

grade_evaluation.et: 5 practical works: practical works are done, the repots are accepted and the experimental results are defended.

resources.mandatory_materials:
1. P. Atkins, J. de Paula, Atkins' Physical Chemistry (7th Ed), Oxford Univ. Press, Trento, Italy, 2002 (or newer editions). 
2. K.J.Laidler, J.H.Neiser, Physical Chemistry, Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston, New York, 1999. 
3. B.E.Conway, Electrochemical Supercapacitors: Scientific Fundamentals and Technological Applications, Kluwer Academic/Plenum Publishers, New York, 1999. 
4. W.A.van Schekwijk, B.Scrosatti (Eds), Advances in Lithium-Ion Batteries, Kluwer Academic/Plenum, New York, 2001 
5. V.Barsukov, F.Beck, New Promising Electrochemical Systems for Rechargeable Batteries, Kluwer Academic Publishers, Nordrecht, bastin, London, 1995. 
6. Y.Gogotsi (Ed), Nanomaterials Handbook, Taylor&Francis, Boca Raton, FL, 2006. 
7. H.Ohno (Ed), Electrochemical Aspects of Ionic Liquids, Wiley Interscience, Hoboven, New Jersey, 2005.

description.et: CV and impedance studies - modelling simple electrochemical systems
